text: The 1921 Belgium–France women's athletics match was an international women's athletics competition where a national team of female French athletes competed against a national team of Belgium. It took place at the venue of C. S. Schaerbeek in Schaerbeek, Belgium on 28 August 1921. It was the first time a match between female French and Belgian teams was held. The match was won by France with 49 points versus Belgium with 28 points. During the match two Belgian national records were broken. During the meeting also some other national events were contested, including the men's national 10 kilometres championships. ==Competition format== The competition consisted of 7 individual events and a relay event. The overall classification is a nation's classification. The winner of each event received 4 points, the number two received 3 points, followed by 2 points and 1 point. The winner of the relay received five points, with the number two receiving two points. For the overall classication, all points scored by the athlete from each country are added together. ==Entrants== The members of the teams were published on 28 August 1921. Names and events in italics or ~~striked~~ are differenced between the entry and athletes competing in the events.
